author: cagkanacarbay
title: Littlefish - Coordinating Action
description: There are no tools on Cardano that meets the needs of distributed communities - coordinating and rewarding action in decentralized groups

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is related to the need for the NFT marketplaces and facilitator as identified within the challenge which needs to be solved. Moreover, NFTs are used with a focus on removing friction and making decentralized collaboration more accessible to everyone. Therefore goals of the proposal are aligned with the Dapps and Integrations challenge. Proposed design ideas including colonies, a gamified UI/UX based on the adventures of littlefish, NFT gallery for littlefish and colonies are quite interesting and it gives a sense of uniqueness with the logo and graphical design. Proposals come up with a decentralized cooperation tool which become popular in other chains as well. Therefore once implemented Cardano ecosystem can greatly be benefited as it will be a collaboration tool example based on the Cardano blockchain. Littlefish Blockchain Features such as NFT, direct donations to colonies and NFT purchases for colony NFTs as well as Colony Features - Members, selling Actions, displaying Actions created by the colony, reward sharing for Action can increase the utility and adoption of Cardano as targeted by this challenge. Future challenges are also considered in the proposal. Besides I suggest bringing real social and environmental purpose-driven NGOs or teams on board during the design process. Therefore you can better understand their needs.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team provides the relevant technical skills and experience needed to implement the proposal. Although the total number of team members are not identified, a number of hours for each work is clearly identified for implementing the different tasks of the proposal. I assume the current team of 6 is going to work on and not any other external resource is needed. It seems the team is reliable and well-formed they have  a proven history of work and the team remained although they were not funded in the previous fund cycle.
A reasonable budget is outlined clearly and broken down into identifiable items. The sustainability of the system to fund future activities are identified to be solved by giving value for different pieces of the platform through NFTs purchased by Littlefish Foundation. In that way, the team is planning to reward the contribution to the platform. Although these NFTs may later be displayed in the Platform where they gain value or not, it is critical to decide which parts to be made NFTs. I suggest the team have a strategy on that as it would not be feasible to generate NFTs for all pieces in the platform.
The timetable shows details of the work which will be completed for each month. Given team experience in software development and business development planned work looks achievable. The proposal provides a sensible and conductible plan for implementation that shows know-what know-how information. For example, the team chose WordPress as the main platform integration which can ease the broader adoption by users of WordPress. 
Looking at the video regarding the team working on the architecture and design provides evidence that the team has implemented several meetings so the team-building process has already started which synergies the next collaborations. Although challenges and risks are explained, strategies for avoiding risks and challenges are not clearly explained. For example, it is identified that the “main challenge will be to technically specify, implement and test Action NFTs”. I suggest you consider inviting external experts to the meetings where you particularly focus on that aspect of the platform. Organising such thematic sessions can allow you to think out of the box and explore new ways of problem-solving.
f6_assessments.q2: A roadmap with milestones and a time horizon for achievement are provided by the team. They already set up communication channels with the community in an open manner. As they use Github they specified commits and usable demos as a metric to show project technical progress. Besides the community participation measure is planned to be proven by Discord activity. Moreover, the number of users (littlefish), Number of colonies created, Daily/Total amount of donations, Number of NFTs minted, Number of NFTs sold are actual KPIs for proving the platform assess the success of the proposal. Audibility is well designed, there are deliverables identified per month that make auditing the proposal easier. The team have a clear understanding of the targeted problem and they well described it for outsiders to observe progress.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is very innovative. I can see this becoming a very common thing in the Cardano Ecosystem. It is something that I haven't seen before, but I can see how it could play such an important role in keeping the community involved and making friends online. This could even turn into conversation about building on the blockchain or brainstorming new ideas to help the scalability of Cardano. This proposal talks about the uniting of "littlefish" and creating something big and united.
f6_assessments.q1: Looks like there is a great team that has been looking into this project for some time and they are ready to get going. I would be interested in participating in this form of a community. The team has lots of experience all together and I believe that the proposal can be implemented successfully because of their desire to create something new that could help the community. The requested funds seem appropriate with what they are trying to create.
f6_assessments.q2: The team has a good vision on how to measure progress within this innovative idea. This could have potential to increase the demand for Cardano and for more people to join these groups. I would hope that these groups will also be able to help each other stay informed and to learn more about blockchain technology. The success of this proposal will be determined by the team's ability to get the message out and to have a great about of participation. This is the only thing I would really like to see happen before saying this is a fantastic proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: Proposal is bringing an important question as we look at 1000s of projects proposed over funds by 1000s of teams, but there is not a full-fledged system advantage of the 1000s of team members coming together. Little fish is bring these experts from different domains and to be aligned to the projects of their choice and be paid in rewards/NFTs/tokens for their work and contribution.
f6_assessments.q1: Team experience - Very high, Costs - Fair and accurate, Team has broad experience and is also onboarding additional members who are engaged through its own project model of littlefish coming together. Plan of execution is extremely feasible given the team is using its project and few other catalyst as MVP already. Team is having weekly meetings and sharing progress and tracking their work in github/youtube/miro for constant alignment as well as growth.
f6_assessments.q2: KPIs shared for number of users or littlefish joining, number of colonies or projects, and payment modalities using donation/nfts/tokens is auditable and trackable. Catalysts teams alrady utilizing the LittleFish framework is a good sign of the need in catalyst system to have a framework of development teams/experts and projects with ease of gaining push/momentum from strengths available instead of being the newbie without resources. This project will be a huge complement to the catalyst system.

f6_assessments.q0: This is an innovative approach of swarm intelligence to decentralized governance of impact-oriented communities. The project harnesses the Cardano community towards good through the development of various tools which will be integrated into a broader governance platform - including a token and a very original manner of valuing work through NFT minting - which when bought will become donations fueling future work.
f6_assessments.q1: The proponents have already demonstrated dedication to their cause - to make Cardano accessible as a governance platform to harness the collective work of communities that act as a force for good multiplier. Besides a former submission that was unfunded, they worked on it and produced already results on which they will build further.
f6_assessments.q2: The "proof" will be in the "pudding" since the tools will be available for use and the metrics chosen are all directly verifiable in a transparent manner. I have no doubt that this work will at a minimum make a significant, and very original contribution to the yet unsolved problem of harnessing collective action through decentralized governance while measuring the impact and value of the work accomplished.

f6_assessments.q0: Littlefish presents a proposal to help with coordination in communities in the Cardano ecosystem by making tools that help incentivise the right actions and behaviours from a communities members. Initially the proposal team looks to improve their website, add blockchain features and then colony and littlefish specific features. Coordination and incentives is one of the main issues faced in growing decentralized communities due to the lack of tools and structures in place to help them scale. An effective execution of this proposal could mean improving the community building capabilities of the other applications and communities building in the ecosystem. Due to this the proposal addresses the challenge. The risks covered are fair and detail the risk of technical execution, social challenges and getting adoption.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal outlines a month by month task list breakdown. The budget is broken down with the number of hours and an hourly rate for each of the main roles within the project. The team provide a list of all the members with a short description, their LinkedIn profile and a Github profile where relevant. Based on the diversity of the team involved, a fair budget for the tasks being completed and the evidence that has been provided it looks likely that this team will be able to execute against the proposal plans.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal provides a list of social media and sources to track the progress of the proposal. This includes a Github repository which will be effective at tracking the development work but also allowing the community to learn from the execution of the team. For measuring progress the team highlights some high levels metrics such as users, NFTs minted, colonies created. It would have been good to have some areas a bit more specific here like specific interactions that would be valuable or certain actions the team is trying to support and measuring that.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal identifies a problem within the Dapps challenge that must be resolved, generating a mix between a Dapps and generating a great impact in generating value for the Cardano ecosystem. The metrics show a clear knowledge of the challenge and it is correctly adapted to it.
f6_assessments.q1: The proponent provides good evidence regarding his abilities and has good experience in the matter. Clearly knows the necessary team members. The budget has a clear development and explanation of its objectives. At the same time the cost is reasonable to meet the proposed objectives. A reasonable schedule is presented, perhaps a bit short. However, it has a sensible implementation plan. It is important to note that it has a broad description of technical aspects and experiences already underway. Handling the project properly and you feel the enthusiasm when reading it.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal includes important mechanisms for monitoring and clearly identified milestones. It has a time horizon for the achievements and clearly describes the objective. The strategy is attractive and the information is accessible from this moment.

solution: A platform that coordinates decentralized collaboration by incentivizing execution and rewarding action
experience: 20+ years experience of Software Development, hardware and network infrastructure. Plutus developers, entrepreneurs, community members
